article.headline: Montana St. 85, Portland St. 82
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. -- Will Bynum scored 24 points, including a pair of free throws to seal the win, as Montana State beat Portland State 85-82 Sunday. Bynum sank his free throws with 5 seconds remaining to hold off a last minute rally by Portland State (15-7, 6-3 Big Sky). Erik Rush scored 13 points and Divaldo Mbunga scored 12 points and had eight rebounds for Montana State (11-9, 5-4). Dominic Waters led Portland State with 19 points while Julius Thomas scored 17 and Phil Nelson added 12. Portland State took a 41-40 lead early in the half, but the Bobcats responded with a 15-4 run to take control of the game.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
